# 2025 Progressive Conservative Party of Prince Edward Island leadership election

| numcands = 1
}}
The Progressive Conservative Party of Prince Edward Island will elect a new leader as successor to Dennis King, at a date to be deterimined. The election was triggered on February 20, 2025, after King announced his resignation as leader of the Progressive Conservative Party and Premier of Prince Edward Island, effective the following day. The PC caucus selected Rob Lantz as Premier and interim leader, pending the election of his successor. The Greens held a leadership election in June and the Liberals held a leadership election in October.
Timeline
* February 20, 2025 – Progressive Conservative leader and Premier Dennis King announced his resignation (effective the following day), in a press conference.
* February 21, 2025 – King resigns, Rob Lantz appointed interim leader and Premier until a successor is elected.
Candidates
Declared
* Mark Ledwell, lawyer. Declared May 22, 2025.
*Jamie Fox, MLA for Borden-Kinkora (2015–2023), interim leader of the Progressive Conservative Party of Prince Edward Island (2015–2017)
*Jamie Ballem, MLA for Stanhope-East Royalty (1996–2007)
*Jean Charest, Premier of Quebec (2003–2012), Deputy Prime Minister of Canada (1993), leader of the Progressive Conservative Party of Canada (1993–1998)
}}
